page.title: 08EVENTS
page.content: For many years Hullavington has had a Carnival during the last week of June, culminating in a parade of decorated vehicles leading to a Village Fete. Most of the funds raised by this event went to maintain the Community Hall. Unfortunately a lack of helpers led to the reduction of the Carnival to a Village Fete & Dance during 1985. A very successful Fete took place at the new Primary School on July 6th. All the organisations listed in the Communications page joined in, as did R.A.F. Hullavington & The School. Events included a{Childrens' Fancy {Dress Competition, a Pram Race, {Country Dancing, a Knobbly Knees {Contest & Tug-of-War.}Sideshows & stalls varied from {White Elephant, & {Coconut Shy to Hamster Racing & {Skittles.}The profit was shared among Hullavington's School, News & Hall.
